item.title: Epic is making it easier to create MetaHumans
item.description:
Epic Games has significantly streamlined the creation and use of its incredibly realistic MetaHuman characters. The biggest announcement is the integration of the MetaHuman Creator directly into Unreal Engine 5.6. This removes a significant hurdle for developers, making the process of incorporating these high-fidelity characters into their projects much simpler and more efficient. Previously, using MetaHumans involved a separate workflow, adding complexity to the development pipeline.
Beyond the integration, Epic has enhanced the MetaHuman creation tools themselves. The sophisticated face-authoring capabilities, previously limited to facial features, are now extended to body creation, allowing for highly customized and detailed character models. This level of control provides developers with unprecedented flexibility in designing their characters. Furthermore, developers can now monetize their creations by selling their custom MetaHumans on Epic's Fab marketplace, opening up new revenue streams.
Finally, and perhaps most surprisingly, Epic has expanded the licensing options for MetaHumans. This means that the highly realistic characters are no longer confined to the Unreal Engine ecosystem. Developers can now utilize MetaHumans in competing game engines like Unity and Godot, as well as popular 3D modeling and animation software such as Maya, Houdini, and Blender. This significantly broadens the potential reach and application of MetaHuman technology, making it accessible to a much wider range of creators and projects. The demonstration of real-time animation using only a consumer webcam further highlights the accessibility and ease of use of the updated system. In short, Epic is democratizing access to its cutting-edge character creation technology.
Source: The Verge
